page.title: 02FIRE STATION WELWYN GARDEN
page.content: Mr Mably, my Dad, showed us round his fire station. The fire engines have two-tone horns and blue lights to get people out of the way. The engines can go 80 mph. The speed limit is 70 mph. Firemen have rankings, station officer (in charge) sub officer (my Dad's rank) and leading fireman. The rest are crew. There are between four and six firemen on one shift. The area that the station covers is small. That is because there are three other stations that are nearer the motorways and other busy roads and villages. The station mainly covers WGC and the factories. It has two engines. If one engine is called out and there is another fire, the retain go out in the second engine. The station has four groups, Green, Blue, White and Red watch. There are between five and seven firemen in one watch.
